Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Chandler-AzTraveler
Reviews.Content: Posting under Woodfin as I could not find Hyatt Place San Diego/Sorrento Mesa We purposely picked an area north of San Diego, so that we could drive to areas both south and north of the hotel. It's about half way between San Diego and Carlsbad. The hotel is tucked in the middle of a high tech industrial park; the majority of the hotel's clientele would be young high tech professionals however there were plenty of families visiting too. The room was spacious with full kitchen, living room with sofabed, and a king bed in a separate room. Breakfast was very good. The omelet station was by far the best, as it was always made to order. Food was freshly made in the kitchen. The pool is not heated and is outdoors. We were upgraded upon arrival to the fourth floor. We had to swipe our room key in the elevator in order to gain access to that floor. We enjoyed our stay

Reviews.Title: “Hyatt House (formerly Woodfin), excellent renovations”
Reviews.Author: BornwithPassport
Reviews.Content: Location of the hotel is right in the heart of a business park, which means it is quiet with a lot of accessibility to the major freeways. Stayed here to go to a wedding in San Diego. The rooms were all recently renovated, e.g. marble kitchen counters, etc. The rooms were clean. Bed was comfortable, and the bathroom was spotless. There is also a very large desk for work. I would recommend this hotel for a business trip or a leisurely holiday. It's clean, convenient, and priced right. My only grip is that the breakfast needs improvement, but heck there is a mini kitchenette in your room - make your own breakfast or eat out. Parking is free. Tip: Get courtyard facing. You'll face the pool/landscaped area. Otherwise your facing a parking lot.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for an extended stay”
Reviews.Author: Nathan S
Reviews.Content: I stayed for almost a week and really enjoyed the property. The newly remodeled courtyard rooms are very nice and quiet. The kitchenette was more than adequate for basic cooking and the bed was very comfortable. Staff was friendly. The restaurant is a bit pricey but quality was excellent, and the complimentary breakfast service was great. I have no complaints whatsoever!

Reviews.Title: “My Best Hotel Experience Eve”
Reviews.Author: Dolatnoush
Reviews.Content: I cannot say enough about this hotel: 1- The amenities 2- Convenient location 3- Cleanliness 4- Quality of the bed and pillows among other furnitures 5- Quietness 6- Quality of breakfast 7- Last but not least, amazing staff

Reviews.Title: “Nice Vacation Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Newbie_Vacationer
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the Hyatt Summerfield Suites San Diego / Sorrento Mesa for a week in August 2011. The hotel was good and functional. Previously the Woodfin Suites, the hotel was slightly dated, but clean. The room was quite spacious with full kitchen, living room with sofabed, and a king bed in a separate room. The room could use a bit of refresh, as the carpets were probably the most dated. Breakfast was very good, as the menu changed "slightly" every day. Food was freshly made in the kitchen. The omelet station was by far the best, as it was always made to order. I was not able to make it back to the hotel in the afternoon to participate in the afternoon food festivities. In terms of location, I purposely picked an area north of San Diego, so that we could drive to areas both south and north of the hotel. It's about half way between San Diego proper and Carlsbad. The hotel is tucked in the middle of a high tech industrial park - the majority of the hotel's clientele would be young high tech professionals. The pool is not heated and is outdoors. The pool is located in the center atrium, so it's out of the sun for a good part of the day. I was expecting that in August, the pool temp was decent. However, my kids started to shiver within a short amount of time. Hotel service was also very good. Would certainly stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable Stay at Hyatt Summerfield Suites”
Reviews.Author: coconutfan2010
Reviews.Content: Check-in process: Fast and easy. Fumi was the staff who checked us in and she was nice. She provided a business card in case we needed anything. Room: Spacious, condo-type living. There was a living room area with a flat screen tv and then another flat screen tv in the master bedroom. Spacious washroom. The hotel was quiet and sleep quality was excellent. Air-conditioning: Quiet and functioning Breakfast: Hot breakfast with a varied menu every day. There was a calendar in our room complete with a list of breakfast items to be served for each day. The breakfast was at the hotel restaurant. On the first day, we had scrambled eggs and sausages. On the second day, there was bacon, mixed ham and egg, sausages and pancakes. There was an attendant who looked after the tables. There was also hot oatmeal in a pot and brown sugar and nuts available. There were freshly cut fruits as well. I really loved the pancakes. Internet: Wired and wireless internet that was free for guests. Decent speed. Parking: Free for guests Elevator: Our room was on the fourth floor. We had to swipe our room key in the elevator in order to gain access to that floor. Other: We tried out their gym facility. It basically had one bike and one elliptical only. There was one yoga ball. There was also a tv in the gym. It was a below average hotel gym. Overall: A lovely hotel stay overall in the San Diego area. I would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Now the Summerfield Suites, GREAT HOTEL!”
Reviews.Author: wilef
Reviews.Content: There was a bit of a hiccup at the start (through priceline you don't get an actual suite), but was able to upgrade to the suite for very little extra. Their breakfast is spectacular for a freebie (personalized omelet, yummy!), the rooms were spacious enough for us and our 2 little kids. Pool was only okay, but overall I was very impressed with what we got for the price! The location was great except if you want to go somewhere during the week at rush hour. It's in more of a business center, so getting onto the freeway at 5pm is a nightmare.

Reviews.Title: “Mislead with information from Hyatt Sutterfield”
Reviews.Author: Notascrub
Reviews.Content: I reserved a 1 room suite and when I arrived, I was told by manager that guest who stayed night before wanted another night when hotel was sold out and California law forbids them from removing someone from room. Relative is GM of a hotel told me that not law, that I was bumped because I was on travel agent discount rate and they were paying full rate stay for holiday weekend. I was bumped a handicap room and WAS NOT comped for it, instead half off room rate and points. I drove 500 miles and had guests who had to have their kids sleep on floor with no pillows!!! Also, kids running up and down halls and when I spoke to someone about it, I was told that security was there to handle it but I never saw security during my stay. Sunday breakfast room was understaffed. I saw manager( yes the same manager) working the floors along with maintenance personal. Coffee, plates and silverware were constantly being waited on. As an independent travel agent as well as a regular visitor to San Diego to see family, I couldn't possibly recumbent this hotel to family or clients. 1st impression is a bad one.

Reviews.Title: “Hopefully, Hyatt will make improvements!”
Reviews.Author: CalKat
Reviews.Content: (Hyatt has recently bought the Woodfin Suites Hotel.) We stayed at this hotel for a college visiting trip because my husband has stayed here often on business and liked it. When we first got there, we noticed an unpleasant odor in the hallways, which continued throughout our stay. The room decor is old and faded, with chips and cracks in the formica countertops. When we tried to pull out the hideabed for our daughter to sleep there, we discovered it was broken! We could not change rooms because the hotel was full. On Thursday, after a long day out at UCSD, we came back at 6 p.m. to discover our room had never been cleaned. : ( On the positive side, the bed was very comfortable, the free wireless worked flawlessly, the free breakfast is very good and includes made-to-order omelets and a choice of indoor/outdoor seating, there is a nice interior courtyard with a pool, almost every room has a balcony, and the hotel staff are very friendly and pleasant. Hopefully Hyatt will make huge improvements in the facilities so these great people can be proud of their hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Family loved the location!”
Reviews.Author: zdwyer
Reviews.Content: We revisited this hotel after many years... And its still as great as our first visit. The service was way above our expectations. The breakfast in the morning was filling and very complete. The did use the pool the two days we were there and it was clean, well lit and HEATED!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place. Quiet and super clean.”
Reviews.Author: spendoctor
Reviews.Content: I stayed here on a recent business trip. The location is great for many of the biotech companies in San Diego. Room was very comfortable. I was really impressed with how clean the room was. Bathroom too. Seemed to be a quiet hotel which I appreciate when traveling for business. The breakfast at the Oasis Grill in the hotel was delicious. Wait staff was quick and courteous. I would highly recommend this hotel to family and friends.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Value self contained suite”
Reviews.Author: Ikorel
Reviews.Content: Under $100 per night via Expedia, in the middle of the Biotech area outside San Diego, $50 cab ride from the airport. Staff are great really helpful and friendly, suites are big, well looked after and kept clean, most seem to have a balcony too

Reviews.Title: “Great place for extended stay”
Reviews.Author: BrishBhan
Reviews.Content: A very neat and clean place and very near to the business hub of San Diego. The place is a good choice if you are planning to be there for a longer duration. The hotel does provide a kitchenette along with the routine suite having LCD television, a reclibner etc. The view from the room, irrespective of which one you get or take is great.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Unknown_Traveler
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for two weeks while vacationing in the SD area. Location and surrounding amenities: This hotel is located amongst several large business parks approximately 5 minutes east of I-805. There there are several hotels in the immediate vicinity. Within walking distance there is a Chili's and a strip mall with Asian and a bakery, though it is only open on the weekdays. Within a 10-15 minute drive to the east are several restaurants, grocery and other retail. Room: A king suite with a kitchen (stove top, convention/microwave oven, dishwasher and separate bedroom. The living room had a couch, chair, desk, TV, and DVD player. There was a small deck. Large bathroom with shower/tub. Bedroom had a large closet and chest of drawers and TV. The room was more like an apartment than your typical hotel room. Hotel Amenities: An interior courtyard has an outdoor pool (a tad cool) and hot tub. The hotel has a restaurant with inside and outside seating adjacent to the pool (separated by a wrought iron fence and sprinkled with palm trees and fountain). Other amenities include guest laundry, business center, and conference rooms. The restaurant appeared to be nice spot for happy hour. Hotel staff: Staff was pleasant and helpful. No complaints. Bottom line: This was wonderful stay, with an excellent room and amenities. The location amongst business parks was surprisingly quiet. If in the area again, would not hesitate to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Scrapbook retreat 2010”
Reviews.Author: larrysrn
Reviews.Content: The staff here was incredible. I felt like a celebrity. I was always greeted with a smile. Anything I wanted they made sure I had it. They were very accommodating. The Oasis restaurant had excellent food. I will definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Great service and there wasn't any troubles”
Reviews.Author: mr007agent
Reviews.Content: Great prices on alcohol for a weekend. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone in sunny San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Spacious rooms are great for family”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegovisitor_10
Reviews.Content: We have stayed a number of times at the Woodfin and enjoy the spacious rooms and kitchen. Our teenagers enjoy the pool, jacuzzi and exercise room. Temperature control in the rooms is better than most hotels. The location is reasonably nearby to Del Mar beach and other San Diego attractions. Considering the roominess and the amenities, the Woodfin is a good value.

Reviews.Title: “Children Friendly”
Reviews.Author: KiwiMochi
Reviews.Content: Stayed their one night with my husband and 3 nephews. Pros: The checking in and out process was quick and easy. Our 1 bedroom King size suite was pleasant, spacious, and SUPER CLEAN! The service and staff there are very quick and lax; I had asked for extra towels and got them in less than 10 mins. We were allowed to use the pool past hours posted. Free parking. About 6 mins away from a plaza with several dining options. Cons: The hotel hallways are smelly. I thought it smelled like B.O. but my husband and nephews said it was more like pencil shavings. The elevator is very old in appearance and smell and can definitely use an upgrade. I had expected my room to smell funny too but luckily it didn't. Ice machine was available only on the 2nd floor. I think we might have gone there on a children convention weekend or something because the hotel was just packed with all these tweens running around on their own.

Reviews.Title: “Poor service”
Reviews.Author: JayGott
Reviews.Content: Tried to arrange a small banquet for a post-funeral. Because of timing of death contacted front desk on a Friday afternoon for a Monday afternoon event for about 75. NOBODY available to commit, no way to get a hold of sales and catering, and when the person at the front desk said they'd try to find someone I gave them till Saturday noon to get back to me. No one did and then when I called back the person at the desk said they just couldn't commit till Monday morning when sales and catering was available. So I called the Doubletree in Carmel Valley (5 minutes away) and front desk person located the Executive Chef within 10 minutes who called me back and made arrangements. If this is indicative of the service difference between the two hotels you would be wise to choose Doubletree over Woodfin for all needs.

Reviews.Title: “If you need help, DON'T ask JEFF at the front desk”
Reviews.Author: jillgriff
Reviews.Content: When I stayed here the hallways had an odd smell and the person at the front desk, named Jeff I believe, was very very rude. I was just wondering about the pool being unheated and he basically talked to me like I was 5 years old.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice hotel, great for the family”
Reviews.Author: windychris1
Reviews.Content: This is our 3rd time staying at Woodfin. The room was a 1 bedroom suite -- the kids slept in the living room area on a sleeper sofa. The room was very clean and well maintained. This hotel is nice because it is centrally located to many areas in SD. The beach is literally 5 minutes away (Torrey Pines). Downtown is about 20 minutes south and Carlsbad is about 20 minutes north. The hotel has a nice pool and spa area. I would recommend this hotel to anyone, especially families travelling with children.

Reviews.Title: “Woodfin Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DisneyfanPooler_GA
Reviews.Content: This was a nice hotel, restaurant staff was very friendly, food was good. Room was comfortable.

Reviews.Title: “Unexpected quality for price”
Reviews.Author: twowheelreviews
Reviews.Content: We like to book a weekend getaway from time to time just to be someplace different. We took a chance on the Woodfin in Sorrento Mesa area of San Diego and were very pleasantly surprised. The Weekend price for a suite was around 90 bucks (plus intenet booking charges). The room was huge and had two TVs and very nice appointments plus a working kitchen. The Queen Bed was very comfortable and had upscale linens and comforter. The hotel surrounds a lushly landscaped courtyard with a pool and jacuzzi. There is a restaurant/bar that meanders out to the center court. It looked very inviting but we didn't dine there this time. There was loads of free parking. It's located in a commercial/industrial area and generally caters to business travelers, but we didn't care, we were looking for a relaxing " jump off the planet" weekend and this lovely hotel more than filled the bill. My only disappointment was that the pool heater was offline for service and the pool was, shall we say, very bracing.

Reviews.Title: “Good rates. Friendly people. Large comfortable suites.”
Reviews.Author: marnewyork
Reviews.Content: This is the second time we have been here. We plan to return 3/2010.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable good value hotel, beautiful room”
Reviews.Author: dlisbona
Reviews.Content: A very modern and squeeky clean hotel in a business district on the north side of San Diego. Close (but not too close) to the freeway, big comfortable room, bathroom and kitchen, big comfortable bed. Very good value (booked on the Internet)

Reviews.Title: “Family Friendly - Solid 3* hotel”
Reviews.Author: ISqueek
Reviews.Content: Stay: 7/29/9-8/1/9 Price: $60 (priceline) + $20 upgrade to suite Cons: My bed was ready to be retired, Hot tub jets weren't working Pros: Kid friendly: Free DVD rentals from the front desk Full Kitchen, Free Parking, Friendly Staff, Nice (small) pool.

Reviews.Title: “Yes!”
Reviews.Author: SGT_West
Reviews.Content: The Woodfin Suites in San Diego is everything you want in an establishment. If you need anything the staff will make it happen before you can ask a second time. the rooms are more than special. If you wanted to save some money on a slow night you can cook right in your room or you could go to there amazing resturant that never has the same thing twice. In other words if you have a chance to stay at the Woodfin jump on it. You won't be dissapointed and you will always compare future hotels against the Woodfin.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value”
Reviews.Author: imshocked2
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel for my trip to welcome my son home from his recent deployment. Its close proximity to the Miramar base and more importantly - the availability of a kitchen, so that he could enjoy a couple of Mom's home cooked meals. The size was perfect and allowed each of us adequate privacy as well. The desk and grounds staff were wonderful and common areas were clean and updated. I will agree with the other reviewers that the housekeeping staff could use some training and supervision. They did not replace coffee or toiletries and came to the room at erratic and often inconvenient times. Two separate days they knocked once, then immediately used a pass key to open the door without waiting. It was frightening. All they would do is make beds, empty trash and dropped clean towels and that was the extent of their service. The carpets and furnishings are dated and worn, but overall the hotel was clean and comfortable. Finally, the quality of the OASIS was incredible. Whether eating in the dining room or ordering room service. They were first class service and some of the best tasting food ever!

Reviews.Title: “Great Getaway”
Reviews.Author: LovetoeatoutTucson
Reviews.Content: My wife and I checked in for a three night stay, just to get-away. The front desk was extremely friendly at check-in and they moved us to the 4th floor upgrade without even asking. The room was large and comfortable and most importantly CLEAN! The motel is located about 15 minutes from downtown San Diego and approximately 1 hour and 15 minutes from Disneyland. We left the motel at 10:00 am one morning and arrived at Disneyland at 11:15. A straight shot on the 805 to the 5. We also ventured down to specific beach and walked along the beach. This drive was approximately 15 minutes as well. Te grounds of this hotel are very nice, the pool was perfect and the restaurant was great! I would recommend a stay here if you are looking for a hotel that isn't in the heart of the city. It is a great place to simply relax!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent venue for Sporting Teams and families!”
Reviews.Author: soccermgr22
Reviews.Content: Have taken 3 teams of minimum 20 up to 45 for stays for soccer tournaments and staff, ammenties and location to fields are wonderful. Reccomend staying at Woodfin if booking for a large group. Rooms with kitchens, great pool and social area and gym with access to reatsuarnts walking distance away make this the perfect venue.

Reviews.Title: “You get what you paid for!”
Reviews.Author: Madimel
Reviews.Content: We got a great deal through priceline for a 3 star. The hotel was near freeway. We stay there for five nights. Hotel was very noisy, you can hear your neighbor talking. The hallways had a bad ordor, can smell it right away when you open the door. The roads near the hotel has a couple potholes. Be careful when driving near hotel. We had a flat tire on our last day there.

Reviews.Title: “Would never go inside this place again !!!”
Reviews.Author: ibuprofenman
Reviews.Content: Booked this hotel through Priceline for 6 nights not knowing much about San Diego but was pleased with the price when compared to the hotel advertised price. Indeed the hotel website gave me impression this would be the highlight of our stay with the term "suites" in the title and images of spacious modern fitted out rooms but the reality was very different. On arrival I was allocated a very small room close to a busy road where the noise was awful and within 5 minutes I was back down at reception requesting another room. I was then given another room and the front desk lady quoted it had a "view of the car park". Maybe a few years ago it did but all I could see was something resembling a film set from Tarzan. Anyhow no noise so we started to unpack and look for the fridge to put our drinks in. Quickly realised there was no fridge so phoned down and to my astonishment I was told that the room did not come with a fridge. This is Southern California were the temperatures hit 80 in December and no fridge in a supposed 3 star hotel room !!! An hour or so later we decide to head out for some dinner and look to put our valuables in the room safe. Next problem is that there appears to be no room safe. Another call to the front desk confirms this to be case but now informed that I could upgrade for $20 per night. I decline this offer. On returning to the hotel that evening, I enquire about the complimentary buffet breakfast and I am told this has been suspended. I tell the front desk person that I have the words "complimentary buffet breakfast" on my reservation and he asks to see it. He then photocopies this sheet and tells me to go down to the restaurant in the morning and simply order items off the breakfast menu which will not be charged to the room. Next morning I enjoy breakfast but problems now occur at the end of the meal when I get the bill. I tell the waiter it is free and he looks surprised so calls one of the managers and who inform me that the complimentary buffet breakfast has been discontinued. I explain to him that I have already had this discussion with the front desk guy the previous evening and again show him my confirmation. He then shows it to someone else and it is agreed that the breakfast be charged to my room but they will remove it daily. While not totally satisfactory, I accept this solution because in reality there is nothing else possible. My next few days pass without hassle apart from the minor inconvenience in the restaurant where a large orange juice at breakfast apparently comes in 3 different sizes according to which waiter or waitress is working that morning. However I did find the breakfast themselves good quality. Departing the hotel really sealed the fate of this establishment. In the early hours of our final day, an invoice was put under my door and unbelievably I had been charged for breakfast for the last two days. As we were catching a 6.40am flight I dealt with the night manager who was unaware of the situation regarding my breakfasts and took yet another copy of my reservation but he looked on his system and thankfully he took off the last 2 breakfasts. If the above wasn't enough, for good measure the wakeup call I requested for 3.05am never materialised but that really doesn't matter in the scheme of things.

Reviews.Title: “Basic Extended Stay Type Of Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WillieMillbrae
Reviews.Content: Stayed here twice, once in Feb 2008 and again in Oct 2008. Rooms are clean and well kept. They provide free dvd rental. The shuttle will take you to nearby locations. The location is nice because it is close to restaurants and shopping. A food court is ~0.5mi away. It is approximately in between downtown and Carlsbad. I would have liked for it to be closer to the airport.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice experience”
Reviews.Author: propredicr
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights with wife and two children. I know this is a business hotel, but, figured it would be very quiet. Noise was non-existant. Very close to the freeway, north or south. Only about a 15-20 minute drive to the Zoo, Sea World and Legoland. We've had two great experiences at Woodfin Suites (Emeryville & San Diego). The mini kitchen is convenient with two small children. Plenty of fast food/sit down dining or grocery stores, Von's and Ralph's, are about a 7 minute drive east on Mira Mesa Blvd. Staff was pleasant and helpful as we came in early off a red-eye flight and they made early accomodations for us.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value”
Reviews.Author: cyn0619
Reviews.Content: Found this hotel on Hotel.Com Great value and nice room. Very clean and spacious. Came back to the hotel about 11PM on Saturday night and was completely quiet. Was a little further to Sea World and San Diego Zoo than I thought but not a bad drive. Hotel suite was very clean and comfortable. Would be a nice place to stay for an extended stay had a small kitchen. Had a nice pool area and small workout room. Grounds were kept up nicely. Overall a comfortable hotel at a great value. I would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Noisiest vacation experience ever”
Reviews.Author: JavDad
Reviews.Content: We selected the Woodfin for a five night vacation based on a stay at the same property several years ago and the TA reviews which talked about the hotel being quiet. One night after our arrival, the hotel was invaded by a horde of youth girl soccer players, parents and coaches. To say that these people were noisy, unruly and inconsiderate would be a sweeping understatement. The parents were even worse. They seemed to think that the hallways were an extension of their rooms for their gatherings. As our suite was at ground floor level facing the pool, it was particularly noisy. I went to the front desk to complain about the noise and to ask to be moved. The manager on duty said the hotel was filled for this big tournament and that the staff would stop the noise at 10 pm (which they didn't!). This invasion lasted for the next three nights and ruined our expectations of relaxing in our suite and by the pool. We changed our plans to minimize the time we spent at the hotel. The staff should have been forthright in warning us about the soccer group when we checked in, should have put us into a quieter suite from the outset or certaintly should have moved us when we requested. The property itself is nice for its class, the rooms and suites are spacious,and it has a very nice restaurant. However, the common areas were littered with food and paper.

Reviews.Title: “So glad we chose the Woodfin!”
Reviews.Author: sb444
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise this hotel was. I'd never heard of the chain before and picked it somewhat randomly when looking for a dog friendly hotel in San Diego. Originally tried to stay at the Hilton Del Mar but they were so snotty on the phone that I went with the Woodfin, which was not only much cheaper but better reviewed, and I'm so glad I did. Hotel was very clean, room was absolutely spotless and large bathroom was sparkling. Tasteful decorating, gorgeous bedding. Room a bit small but was just fine. Only stayed one night but found it perfect for what we needed and a great deal as well. Would definitely return if in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Good Value and Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: sgorin79
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed in a suite at the Woodfin after being evacuated due to the San Diego wild fires. While the circumstances were not great, I am pleased to report that the hotel facilities and staff were excellent. The room was comfortable and clean and the small kitchenette was very convenient. The french doors which separated the bedroom and living room were also a nice touch for privacy with 3 people in the room. The bathroom was spacious and clean. The restaurant served good food although it was a bit pricey. The free DVD rental was a nice touch. Also, I must mention the staff, from the front desk to housekeeping to the wait staff in the restaurant, everyone was extremely professional, kind and courteous. I would definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Decent hotel for the whole family”
Reviews.Author: Point2point
Reviews.Content: Stayed in early August and the place was fully booked. However, it seemed quiet despite being busy. Tucked away in a business park, but plenty of parking. The one bedroom suite was clean and modern. No weird smells in hall or room. Kitchenette: large fridge, dishwasher, small stovetop (no oven), toaster, dishes, dishcloths & d/w soap provided (no dish soap provided - oversight by maid?) Small salt & pepper, sugar packets, coffee. Awkward layout for groceries. Master bedroom: large king bed, microsuede duvet cover, very comfortable. Plenty of TV channels, but NO DVD player (only in main room). Bathroom: nice soaps, large layout, medium shower pressure. Main area: fold out couch was good for one kid. Enough room to add a cot. TV seemed small in the space, but was fine. Awkward placement for the TV behind the desk, so anyone working on a computer there would block the TV (fine since there was another TV in the bedroom). Internet: rooms only have a plug-in connection and a charge for this service. The Internet cable barely reaches into the bedroom and the hotel should consider longer ones. Free Internet is available in the lobby and restaurant areas. Restaurant: happy hour was fun; mini Kobe beef burgers half price ($7) and tasty. Located next to the pool area. Surprised that breakfast was NOT included in the price of the room -- we did not try it. Chili's was the nearest walking distance restaurant. Other: Laundry service expensive. $7.50 to launder a shirt. Cheaper to go to Target/Old Navy and buy a new one. Also, they do accept pets. Pool was very warm, but the kids loved it. Some seating is still in the splash zone, so watch your laptop. A variety of DVDs to rent (a deposit is charged to the room, but removed when DVD is returned). Small store near lobby but expensive. Drive east on Mira Mesa to Target and Vons for items you may need. Movie theaters & restaurants further east. Overall a good experience and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not bad, but horrible smell in the hallways.”
Reviews.Author: marko1177
Reviews.Content: Comfortable bed and clean room. Had some problems with the plumbing and there was a horrible smell of B.O. in the hallways on the 2nd floor. I would reccomend for a short stay.

Reviews.Title: “Large rooms, too many things broken”
Reviews.Author: RonnyS
Reviews.Content: Reserved a suite with kitchen. Loved the design of the rooms/kitchen, but too many things were broken. 1. The first night, we discovered that the bathtub (3rd floor) wasn't draining. The day after maintenance was sent up but they couldn't fix it, so we had to move ourselves to another room. 2. After the second night (in the new room we moved to), we discovered that the heating wasn't working. They sent maintenance to fix it. He said he fixed it "temporarily" as the AC unit was going to die real soon. He himself said "you can hear it from the noise" (it sounded like there's gravel in the AC motor). 3. The person at the reception sold us on the great breakfast Buffet, so we went down to eat only to discover that there's no buffet during these "low occupancy times" in late December. 4. One night my son wanted to go down to the hot-tub, but it was cold. Talking to the receptionist, the person said they turn it off on cold days or if it rains (it did rain in the morning). A maintenance person was called and turned the heater on, but said it will take several hours.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay at the woodfin”
Reviews.Author: DavidDC
Reviews.Content: A nice business hotel, in a business location. The suites are oddly configured: the seating areas (and beds) don't face the televisions so you have to angle yourself to view them. The courtyard breakfast is a nice touch.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant Stay at the Woodfin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Woodfin Suites for two nights in June when my husband ran the Rock n' Roll Marathon. Overall, we were quite pleased with the accomodations. The hotel seems very new and modern and as a result has nice, spacious rooms that are nicely furnished. The kitchen area was quite large for a hotel room and well equiped. Our suite was a true suite with a bedroom seperated by french doors from the kitchen/ living room area. The bed was comfy, and the room was fairly quiet for a hotel room. Our son stayed on the fold out bed in the living room area. It seemed decently comfortable for a sofa bed, and extra sheets and bedding were provided in the closet. The television sets did seem a bit small, but as we don't even own a TV it wan't really a big issue for us. The staff was decent, but not overly helpful. When I went to check out the morning of the marathon there were three employees chatting and they continued to do so for about a minute while I waited for them to finish up. Once they attended to me they were very pleasant to me as well as my two year old son, talking to him and being very cordial. I location of the Woodfin is bit of a drive from dowtown San Diego, Mission Valley, and most San Diego attractions but quite do-able if you have a car. The neighborhood is comprised of modern office buildings with not a whole lot of restaurants in the immediate area, there are however plenty down the street about a 5-10 minute drive. I would reccommend this hotel for families in which the adults would appreciate the privacy of a seperate bedroom. As far as accomodations go I think the room was defintely a good value for the money. We would stay at the Woodfin again.

Reviews.Title: “Winding down at Woodfin”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Easy-to-access suites hotel in an industrial park several blocks off freeway. Coffee shop & minimarket next door. Spacious 1-bedroom suite was room for a family of 4 for 5 days while site-seeing around San Diego. Seaworld, LaJolla, Delmar, Old Town, Zoo with 15-20 min. car ride. Tiny balcony (no chair) overlooks lush courtyard & pool surrounded by palm trees. Staff very helpful and responsive. Business office with Internet access allowed us to print coupons to local attractions & boarding passes for flights home. Well-equipped kitchenette- full size frig, stove, microwave, diswasher,pots, pans, plates, flatware, etc allowed us to eat in or carry out. Many restaurants & shopping witin short driving distance. Definitely a good value, compared to pricey downtown hotels @ AAA rate of $159 a night. Restaurant at the hotel recently opened. Our food was bland.

Reviews.Title: “Great for Families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family of six stayed here last July. We had a two bedroom suite and it was great. The price is very affordable especially when we would have been paying for two rooms at a regular hotel. It was our base for visiting the San Diego area. It is very convenient to many SD attractions and the Wildlife Park. The rooms were clean, although basic. We really enjoyed the included hot/cold breakfast. Overall, I would say that this is a very good value.

HotelInfo.Name: Woodfin Suites Hotel, Sorrento Mesa
HotelInfo.Address: 10044 Pacific Mesa Blvd., San Diego, CA 92121
